shape_image_tags.backend_description: A perfectly proportioned square filled with royal blue color on a white card background. This represents a special type of rectangle where all four sides are equal in length, helping Grade 4 students explore properties like equal sides, four right angles, and both horizontal and vertical symmetry.

An equilateral triangle with warm golden-yellow color, positioned with its base parallel to the bottom edge. The triangle demonstrates a three-sided polygon with all sides of equal length, helping students learn about triangles as the simplest polygon with three vertices, three sides, and three angles.

solution: We can label the rectangle as A and the triangle as B. The repeating pattern is AB.
The pattern repeats over and over, so the next shapes in order are A, the rectangle, then B, the circle.
